data: NEPH Hemodialysis Catheter-related Bacteremia Confirmed Treatment (Multiphase)
For catheter removal recommendations, refer to Treatment of Catheter-Related Bloodstream Infection algorithm
Conditional Order - Nurse to Place Lab Order - Ongoing
If/when positive blood culture, then order blood cultures x 2 with next hemodialysis run
Conditional Order - Nurse to Place Lab Order - Ongoing
If/when one week post last dose of antibiotics, then order blood cultures x 2
Routine, Reason: Other (please specify), Additional Reason: rule out endocarditis
Routine, Schedule as: Inpatient, Primary Indication: Other (please specify), Special Instructions: Rule out endocarditis
Routine, Schedule as: Outpatient, Primary Indication: Other (please specify), Special Instructions: Rule out endocarditis
Reason for Consult: Labs: Order Pertinent Test, Pharmacist to order subsequent vancomycin levels
For methicillin - resistant organism, select vancomycin
500 mg, IV, hemodialysis, order duration: 2 week, start: T;N+720
750 mg, IV, hemodialysis, order duration: 2 week, start: T;N+720
500 mg, IV, hemodialysis, order duration: 3 week, start: T;N+720
750 mg, IV, hemodialysis, order duration: 3 week, start: T;N+720
3 mL, instillation, hemodialysis, order duration: 3 week
3 mL, instillation, hemodialysis, order duration: 3 week

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)
2,000 mg, IV, hemodialysis, order duration: 2 week, drug form: bag
2,000 mg, IV, hemodialysis, order duration: 3 week, drug form: bag

once, Draw level pre-dialysis of 2nd maintenance dose, target vancomycin level 15 to 20 mg/L
If patient is admitted, select ampicillin
